jobDescription: Job Description: Bank of America Global Access Controls team is seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) Security Specialist to develop and implement quality control methodologies to ensure compliance with QA standards, guidelines, and procedures. The key contributor will develop and define major and minor attributes of QA, including inline and post process QA health scores. In addition, establish and maintain a process for evaluating the control solutions, develop and maintain documentation and conduct formal and informal reviews at pre-determined points throughout the process life cycle. Key Responsibilities include:Evaluation of new laws, rules, regulations and determines the impact on the access review controlsDevelop test procedures and strategies to verify the effectiveness of the control solutionsDrive awareness and knowledge materials to insure accountabilities are clearly understood across the enterpriseContinuously monitor and report on the effectiveness and performance of the control solutions through KPIs and KRIsEnsure control defects are documented and appropriately resolvedCommunicate regularly the health of the control environment through consistent and actionable reportingReview, analyze, and keep current controls related documentation (e.g., Control Overview and Control Playbooks)Required Skills: Must possess 3 + years of related experience in the following areas: Demonstrated understanding of internal control frameworks (COBIT, COSO).Understanding of the SOX IT Controls, FFIEC IT, NIST and exposure to Security or IT audit activities.Ability to understand risk assessments, the identification of mitigation controls and the determination of residual risk.Excellent organizational and project management skills.Excellent oral communication, writing, presentation, and facilitation skills.Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills.Ability to work with minimal supervision.Excellent skills in Microsoft Excel data manipulation and ability to present data in dynamic dashboards that can be quickly understood Desired Skills:Thorough working knowledge of user access types, for example Active Directory, Service Accounts, MainframeMinimum 2 years of experience in QAIT Audit, Audit Liaison, IT Security, Risk or similar rolesCertifications: Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or similar certification is preferredShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40
